intro: Jasione perennis var. carpetana, commonly known as the carpet jasmine, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white to pale yellow. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
